citations.narrative:
The licensee failed to follow the preventative care plans for healthy and unmatted hair coats. The plan states all dogs will
be "groomed every 3 months, brush, clip". The licensee stated these two dogs were due to be groomed in January but
she hadn't done so yet. The licensee stated she would groom both dogs later today.
-Male Shih Tzu "Jasper" MC#9772000097848690 had a thick overgrown coat, the hair on his face loosely covered his
eyes. The hair around his eyes was slightly wet. There were single matts on his back feet and small matts behind the
ears. Several loose matts were found on his abdomen with urine and small pieces of fecal material twisted into the matts.
There was no abnormalities observed with the skin around the matted areas.
-Male Shih Tzu "Doc" MC#977200009783025 had a thick overgrown coat, the hair loosely covered his eyes. He had
matts present on his rear feet. Several loose matts were found on his abdomen with small pieces of fecal material twisted
into the matts. There was no abnormalities observed with the skin around the matted areas.
Overgrown and matted hair coats may cause pain and discomfort to the animal as well as increase the risk of developing
skin and eye conditions. The licensee must follow their preventative care and treatment plans to ensure healthy and un-
matted hair coats, properly trimmed nails, and clean and healthy eyes, ears, skin, and teeth. The licensee must have
these dogs groomed to remove all matting and ensure they follow their preventative care and treatment plan at all times.
To be corrected by: 1-March-2024
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the licensee.
n

narrative:
3.13(a)(4) 
   
Veterinary care for dogs. 
The licensee failed to follow the preventative care plans for healthy and unmatted hair coats. The plan states all dogs will 
be "groomed every 3 months, brush, clip". The licensee stated these two dogs were due to be groomed in January but 
she hadn't done so yet. The licensee stated she would groom both dogs later today.  
-Male Shih Tzu "Jasper" MC#9772000097848690 had a thick overgrown coat, the hair on his face loosely covered his 
eyes. The hair around his eyes was slightly wet. There were single matts on his back feet and small matts behind the 
ears. Several loose matts were found on his abdomen with urine and small pieces of fecal material twisted into the matts. 
There was no abnormalities observed with the skin around the matted areas. 
-Male Shih Tzu "Doc" MC#977200009783025 had a thick overgrown coat, the hair loosely covered his eyes. He had 
matts present on his rear feet. Several loose matts were found on his abdomen with small pieces of fecal material twisted 
into the matts. There was no abnormalities observed with the skin around the matted areas. 
Overgrown and matted hair coats may cause pain and discomfort to the animal as well as increase the risk of developing 
skin and eye conditions. The licensee must follow their preventative care and treatment plans to ensure healthy and un-
matted hair coats, properly trimmed nails, and clean and healthy eyes, ears, skin, and teeth. The licensee must have 
these dogs groomed to remove all matting and ensure they follow their preventative care and treatment plan at all times. 
To be corrected by: 1-March-2024 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the licensee. 
 
 n
